entry.title: Law enforcement search for Riddle man following homicide
entry.summary: RIDDLE — Law enforcement officers are looking for Gauge Douglas James Main, of Riddle, after a shooting Monday night in Riddle left one man dead and sent another to the hospital.

entry.title: Volunteers needed for Reedsport committees
entry.summary: REEDSPORT — The city of Reedsport is seeking applicants for various volunteer boards and committees.

entry.title: DOUGLAS COUNTY’S PAYROLL EMPLOYMENT DROPS IN OCTOBER
entry.summary: November 22, 2023 3:40 a.m. Douglas County payroll employment dropped a seasonally adjusted 240 jobs in October after increases of 70 in September and 200 in August. A State of Oregon Employment Department release said the county has gained back 86 percent of the jobs lost in March and April 2020 at the onset of...

entry.title: FRIENDS OF THE LIBRARY BOOK SALE NEXT WEEK
entry.summary: November 22, 2023 3:30 a.m. The Friends of the Roseburg Public Library will hold their Winter Book Sale in the Ford Room next week. entry.title: ELKTON WITH ANNUAL ART & WINE TOUR THANKSGIVING WEEKEND
entry.summary: November 22, 2023 3:20 a.m. In the KQEN Cultural Spotlight: Elkton’s 13th Annual Art & Wine Tour will be Friday through Sunday. Elkton Community Education Center is organizing the event, which has thirteen sites participating, including seven wineries. Residents can start their tour at ECEC to pick up a passport with a list of all...

entry.title: CHRISTMAS CAROL RADIO SHOW COMING TO UCC
entry.summary: November 22, 2023 3:00 a.m. In the KQEN Cultural Spotlight: Umpqua Community College Performing & Visual Arts presents A Christmas Carol Radio Show. entry.title: FREE FISHING DAYS IN OREGON FRIDAY AND SATURDAY
entry.summary: November 22, 2023 2:40 a.m. The Oregon Department of Fish and Wildlife has free fishing days in Oregon on Friday and Saturday. An ODFW release said no fishing/shellfish licenses or tags are required for those two days. Both Oregon residents and nonresidents can fish for free. All other fishing regulations apply including closures, bag limits...

entry.title: FREE PARKING AT STATE PARKS ON FRIDAY
entry.summary: November 21, 2023 11:20 a.m. The Oregon Parks and Recreation Department is inviting Oregonians to head outside on Friday, the day after Thanksgiving. Popularly known as Green Friday, the day has become a tradition for many families. State parks will again waive the day-use parking fees in the 24 parks that are open and charge...

entry.title: TURKEY TROT HAPPENING THANKSGIVING MORNING AT WILDLIFE SAFARI
entry.summary: November 21, 2023 10:40 a.m. Wildlife Safari has its annual Turkey Trot happening on Thanksgiving morning at 8:00 a.m. The event takes runners and walkers through the park’s carnivore loop where they may be able to see cheetahs and Sumatran tigers running alongside them on the opposite side of the enclosure. entry.summary: November 21, 2023 3:30 a.m. Umpqua Community College recently completed an extensive remodel of its library. entry.title: Thanksgiving comes early for South Umpqua students

entry.title: Pacific Power holds public forum about wildfire risk mitigation plans
entry.summary: WINCHESTER — With time to prepare before the next fire season, PacifiCorp is focused on both long-term and short-term plans for decreasing wildfire risk on its end.
